text: Bronchocela marmorata, marbled crested lizard, marbled bloodsucker or marbled agamid lizard is a species of lizard. It is endemic to the Philippines, where it inhabits lowland dipterocarp and montane forests at elevations 400 to 800 m above mean sea level. It is typically found on branches and leaves of trees. It feeds on insects and is oviparous, digging the soil to lay its eggs at the base of trees.Republic of the Philippines - Stamps & Postal History. philippinestamps.net == References == Category:Agamidae Category:Reptiles described in 1845 Category:Reptiles of the Philippines
title: Bronchocela marmorata
